content.question:
The potential energy diagram for the uncatalyzed decomposition of <math alttext="H 2 O 2, liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above. The arrows labeled A and B represent different amounts of energy. When <math alttext="I with a negative one charge, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is used as a catalyst, how do the magnitudes of A and B in the new reaction energy diagram compare to the uncatalyzed diagram shown above?

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
